subject: Investing
title: Large-Cap, Mid-Cap, Small-Cap
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Large-Cap, Mid-Cap, Small-Cap.

hook.text: Apple is a large-cap at $3 trillion. A regional bank at $800 million is small-cap. Size shapes behavior.

buildup.text: Large-caps are stable giants. They move slowly but survive downturns. Think Coca-Cola or Microsoft.

discovery.text: Small-caps are nimble and volatile. They can double in a year or lose half. Higher risk, higher potential reward.

twist.text: Mid-caps are the sweet spot some investors overlook. They combine growth potential with some stability.

climax.text: Historically, small-caps outperform large-caps by about 2% annually â€” but with much wilder swings.

punchline.text: Size isn't just a label. It predicts how a stock behaves in a storm.

quiz.question: What is a key characteristic of small-cap stocks?
options: Higher volatility and higher potential returns
